description: A makeshift wooden cuirass, actually just a bunch of boards fastened somewhat tight with strings.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
An elaborate wooden cuirass, more thin, flexible and with shoulderpads for better coverage.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
An armor made from thin wooden sheets with carefully cut grooves sewn onto a cloth undershirt.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A suit of armor made from thin wooden sheets with carefully cut grooves sewn onto a cloth gambeson.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A shirt made out of wires, coiled around and sewn into fabric. Not even close to a proper mail, but better than just clothing.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A pair of sleeves made out of wires, coiled around and sewn into fabric. Sacrifices coverage to leave the elbow unencumbered. Not even close to a proper mail, but better than just clothing.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A pair of leggins made out of wires, coiled around and sewn into fabric. Sacrifices coverage to leave the knee unencumbered. Not even close to a proper mail, but better than just clothing.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A makeshift wooden helmet. Heavy, uncomfortable and not quite sturdy, because the pieces are held together with a glue.   This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

Have a spare bottle? Cut it in half, stuff inside some padding, fasten it with rags or string and use as vambraces. Hey, it's better than nothing.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A makeshift plastic breastplate with some padding. Not as good as factory-made football armor, but it's way less bulky and covers more torso area.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A pair of tin cans with removed bottoms and cut open along the side to allow wearing them on wrists. Some rags are wrapped around the sharp sides and to hold it firmly.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A semi-historical(it would be neat to add small pockets) replica of linothorax. Strong, light and comfortable; it has only one flaw - it will fall apart under the rain, and the only way of waterproofing you can think of is the beeswax.   This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation

A vest with dozens of sand-filled pockets. Kinda prone to ripping, and when it happens the sand disperses, making it impossible to repair, only make a new one.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A cardboard visor. Protects from sun glare.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
An armor made from wooden scales with carefully drilled holes sewn onto a cloth undershirt.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A suit of armor made from wooden scales with carefully drilled holes sewn onto a cloth gambeson.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A skullcap hammered out of metal sheet.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A vest with two thin, but nevertheless inflexible metal sheets sealed inside its big pockets.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A plain wooden mask. Looks kinda... creepy.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A pair of arm guards cut from a thick motorbike tire.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A pair of leg guards cut from a thick automobile tire.  This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
A pair of makeshift patchwork pants.   This can be worn regardless of your state of mutation
